Package model

Class DataCenter

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.DataCenter
  • public class DataCenter
extends java.lang.Object
    The class DataCenter is the controller of the program, it represents a data center that is distributed in corridors that in turn have mini-halls. The number of corridors is represented by the constant DATA_CENTER_CORRIDORS and the number of mini-halls per corridor is represented by the constant MINIROOMS_PER_CORRIDOR. From this class is also decided the price that each mini-room will have from a base value and a series of discounts that the mini-rooms will have for being positioned in one place or another.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      DataCenter()
      The DataCenter builder will create the data center along with the mini-rooms in it, assigning each mini-room a rental price according to its position.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataCenter

        public DataCenter()

    • Method Detail

      • listAvailableMinirooms

        public java.lang.String listAvailableMinirooms()
        The listAvailableMinirooms method searches for available minirooms, identified by boolean. In case of being available (not being occupied by any company) the method will save in a message all the information of the minirooms and then return it.
        Returns:
        message: It is a String that contains all the information (attributes) of all the mini-rooms that are available.

      • rentMiniroom

        public java.lang.String rentMiniroom​(java.lang.String name,
                                     java.lang.String nit,
                                     java.lang.String rentalDate,
                                     int serversAmount,
                                     double cacheMemory,
                                     int processorsAmount,
                                     int processorsType,
                                     int disksAmount,
                                     double disksCapacity)
        The rentMiniroom method will occupy a mini-room for a company.
        Parameters:
        name - : Is a String representing the company name.
        nit - : It is a String that represents the company's Nit.
        rentalDate - : Is a String representing the date the miniroom was rented.
        serversAmount - : It is an int that represents the number of servers in the rack that the company wishes to use.
        cacheMemory - : It is a double that represents the amount of RAM cache memory that the servers will have.
        processorsAmount - : It is an int that represents the number of processors that the servers have.
        processorsType - : It is an int whose number will represent the brand of server processors.
        disksAmount - : This is an int representing the number of disks the server has.
        disksCapacity - : It is a double that represents the capacity in Terabytes of the disks.
        Returns:
        message: It is a String containing a message informing of the success or failure of the operation.

      • rentMiniroom

        public java.lang.String rentMiniroom​(java.lang.String projectRegistrationId,
                                     java.lang.String rentalDate,
                                     int serversAmount,
                                     double cacheMemory,
                                     int processorsAmount,
                                     int processorsType,
                                     int disksAmount,
                                     double disksCapacity)
        The rentMiniroom method will occupy a mini-room for an ICESI research project.
        Parameters:
        projectRegistrationId - : It is a String that represents the registration number of the research project.
        rentalDate - : Is a String representing the date the miniroom was rented.
        serversAmount - : It is an int that represents the number of servers in the rack that the company wishes to use.
        cacheMemory - : It is a double that represents the amount of RAM cache memory that the servers will have.
        processorsAmount - : It is an int that represents the number of processors that the servers have.
        processorsType - : It is an int whose number will represent the brand of server processors.
        disksAmount - : This is an int representing the number of disks the server has.
        disksCapacity - : It is a double that represents the capacity in Terabytes of the disks.
        Returns:
        message: It is a String containing a message informing of the success or failure of the operation.

      • cancelMiniroom

        public java.lang.String cancelMiniroom​(int row,
                                       int column)
        The cancelTenantMinirooms method will vacate a mini-room by paying the rent for it.
        Parameters:
        row - : It is an int that represents the row where the miniroom to cancel the rent is located.
        column - : It is an int that represents the column where the miniroom to cancel the rent is located.
        Returns:
        message: A String containing a message with the processing capacity (total disk capacity, total RAM memory) of the mini-rooms whose rental has been cancelled.

      • showDatacenterMap

        public java.lang.String showDatacenterMap()
        The showDatacenterMap method will store in a String a message with the shape of the data center map where you can see the mini-rooms on and off. If a miniroom is on it will appear as x, and if it is off it will appear as 0.
        Returns:
        message: It is a String with the datacenter map showing the mini-rooms on and off.

      • simulateMiniroomsLighting

        public java.lang.String simulateMiniroomsLighting()
        The simulateMiniroomsLighting method will light up all the minirooms in the data center and display a String map of the location.
        Returns:
        message: It is a String with the datacenter map showing the mini-rooms on and off.

      • simulateMiniroomsShutdown

        public java.lang.String simulateMiniroomsShutdown​(char identifyingLetter)
        The simulateMiniroomsShutdown method, based on a letter passed as a parameter, will shut down certain minirooms. The letter X returns the lights of the minirooms to the way they were at the beginning.
        Parameters:
        identifyingLetter - : It is a char that represents the function to be performed.
        Returns:
        message: It is a String with the datacenter map showing the mini-rooms on and off.

      • TurnOffMiniroomsOfALine

        public java.lang.String TurnOffMiniroomsOfALine​(char identifyingLetter,
                                                int number)
        The simulateMiniroomsShutdown method, based on a letter passed as a parameter will perform 2 functions, shutdown a row or shutdown a column of minirooms. It will also identify the column or row from a number passed as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        identifyingLetter - : It is a char that represents the function to be performed.
        number - : This is an int that will identify the column or row of minirooms to be turned off.
        Returns:
        message: It is a String with the datacenter map showing the mini-rooms on and off.
